venue.name: Breakheart Reservation/Chris P. Dunne Visitor Center

item.description:
What's the plan?

The Ridge trail cuts a path across the more challenging terrain at Breakheart, including a portion that passes through a small section of wetland forded by a plank bridge. Flooding from heavy rains and snow melt over the past several years have damaged the bridge beyond repair so the DCR has decided to reroute the Ridge trail around the wetlands and remove the bridge.

The DCR needs some volunteer help to clean up the old bridge site, hauling away the old timber and restoring the site. The project will involve dragging heavy timbers out of the bog area, so expect some hard, muddy work.

We will have full support from the park staff, and rangers… and there will be water and snacks provided to anyone who comes to help with this project!

Where will we meet?

We will be meeting at the Breakheart Reservation visitor parking lot in Saugus located on Forest Street. The actual address: 177 Forest Street Saugus 01906. Please be on time – there is a lot to get done.

What should I bring?

- Work gloves

- Work clothing – there may be some bushwhacking involved, please dress appropriately.

- Water (recommend a minimum of 1 liter)

- Good hiking boots

- Bug Spray (Tick Season)

- Waders if you have them.

More Info

Rain will cancel - I'll send out an email (with my cell phone number) to confirmed participants the night before the event to confirm details.

For more information about Breakheart Reservation check out the offical DCR website: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/breakhrt.htm

Basic map overview map of Breakheart Trails (a little dated but still useful):

http://www.saugus.org/FOBR/maps/BreakheartMap.pdf

Directions

From north or south: Take Rte. 1 to Lynn Fells Parkway exit, follow Lynn Fells Parkway a short distance, take a right onto Forest Street. Park entrance is after Kasabuski Rink.
item.name: Trail work at Breakheart Reservation
